[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 66]
Reasoning: **The Strategic Calculation**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm in Round 8, Ante 3/8, staring down the Boss blind with a -1 hand size. I need to make 1649 chips to clear this blind. I have two hands left, and four discards. My hand is: Jack(S), 6(S), Queen(C), 3(C), 8(D), 6(D), 4(D).

I have the "Ride the Bus" Joker, which gives a hefty +22 Multiplier if I *don't* score with any face cards this round. The "Acrobat" Joker, X3 the final hand, is crucial, so this hand is Hand 2, and the *next* hand is the last. I also have "Midas Mask," which makes Face Cards gold when scored. I *don't* want to score any Face Cards right now, so that's irrelevant. "Greedy Joker" is great – it adds +3 Multiplier to Diamond cards that are *scored*.

My goal is clear: Score a decent chunk of points *without* resetting "Ride the Bus", and set up a killer final hand for the Acrobat. I need to leave myself with a score of 402 or less for the final hand.

Looking at my hand, I see a clear path: play the 8(D), 6(D), 4(D), 6(S), and 3(C) as a High Card (8 of Diamonds). This means no face cards will be played and scored. The 8 of Diamonds will be the Highest Card in this hand. "Greedy Joker" will kick in for the 8(D) and give a +3 multiplier. "Ride the Bus" will provide the other +22 Multiplier since I'm not using a face card.

So, let's break down the math. Base Chips are 35. The 8 of Diamonds adds +8 Chips, for a total of 43 chips. Base Multiplier is 4, "Greedy Joker" gives +3 for the diamond 8, and "Ride the Bus" gives +22, for a total Multiplier of 29. 43 chips times 29 multiplier equals 1247 chips. I've double checked that the Diamonds other than the High Card, (6D, 4D), won't be counted for "Greedy Joker".

This will leave me needing 402 chips to win, which I can absolutely achieve with the final Acrobat hand. Playing the High Card strategy this hand gives me a safe path to victory.

I need to confirm the card positions:
1: J(S)
2: 6(S) -> Play
3: Q(C)
4: 3(C) -> Play
5: 8(D) -> Play (Scores)
6: 6(D) -> Play
7: 4(D) -> Play

This seems correct, and I'll confirm that 43 times 29, is, in fact, 1247. Now let's play this.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
